plant.title: Pothos
plant.summary: Contains calcium oxalate crystals that cause immediate burning and irritation in the mouth, lips, and tongue. Cats often chew it out of curiosity due to trailing vines‚Äîbut even a small bite causes distress.
plant.what_to_do:
**Not usually life-threatening‚Äîbut very painful. Act quickly.**

1. Remove plant fragments from your cat‚Äôs mouth.
2. Rinse gently with cool water.
3. Offer a lick of plain yogurt or a few drops of milk to neutralize crystals.
4. Call your vet if symptoms last more than 2‚Äì3 hours.

> üí° Pro tip: Hang Pothos out of reach‚Äîor replace with a safe vine like **String of Hearts** (non-toxic!).
safe_alternatives: Hoya carnosa (Wax Plant) ‚Äì non-toxic and beautiful!
sources: ASPCA Toxic and Non-Toxic Plants Database
Journal of Veterinary Emergency and Critical Care

If your cat has been exposed to any plant, contact a licensed veterinarian or the ASPCA Animal Poison Control Center immediately. We do not guarantee the accuracy, completeness, or timeliness of this information. Use at your own risk.
